info.title: API Specification
info.description: Merchant integration API specification. Detailed list of error codes can be downloaded from the "Appendix" section from above.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned to the merchant company

parameters.name: brandId
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned to the merchant brand

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Indicates the Payit version used. For Payit version 3 use 'application/app.v3+json' value

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

200.description: Response Payload from Payit Application for eligible banks

cache-control.description: contains the list of active banks and logo URLs

schema.description: contains the list of active banks and logo URLs

Code.description: High level textual error code, to help categorise the errors.

Id.description: A unique reference for the error instance, for audit purposes, in case of unknown/unclassified errors. An RFC4122 UID used as a Error id

Message.description: Brief Error message, e.g., 'There is something wrong with the request parameters provided'

schema.description: An array of detail error codes, and messages, and URLs to documentation to help remediation.

x-transaction-ID.description: Payit Application will response with back with the Transaction id.

ResponseURL.description: This URL will be the Bank login URL. You should redirect to this url, which could open in a browser or in the mobile app of the bank

TPPReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the TPP for the payment

CreationDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2020-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

Code.description: High level textual error code, to help categorise the errors.

Id.description: A unique reference for the error instance, for audit purposes, in case of unknown/unclassified errors. An RFC4122 UID used as a Error id

Message.description: Brief Error message, e.g., 'There is something wrong with the request parameters provided'

schema.description: An array of detail error codes, and messages, and URLs to documentation to help remediation.

post.description: Initiates a new single immediate payment flow

parameters.name: x-transaction-ID
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Related to EndToEndIdentification field in open banking journey

parameters.name: x-FOV-indicator
parameters.description: For production environments do not send this field or send it as false. Fov indicator will be used by to test new features in production , yet these features are not open to public - First occurrence Validation.

parameters.name: x-customer-device
parameters.description: Indicates the customers device or browser version

parameters.name: x-customer-app
parameters.description: Indicates the customers browser name or app version

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Indicates the Payit version used. For Payit version 3 use 'application/app.v3+json' value

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

companyId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Parent Company id

brandId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Brand id

currency.description: The currency in which the payment should be done, according to ISO 4217. For now only GBP is supported.

additionalMessaging.description: Reserved - use as advised by Payit

country.description: The target country, used to filter ASPSPs, according to ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.For now only UK is supported.

description.description: Description for the payment, to be displayed to the user

redirectUrl.description: "The URL of the payment initiating party. This will be used to transfer the payment confirmation back to initiating party from Payit"

countryCode.description: For Ecommerce Goods payments, alongside the paymentContext code field, this is also mandatory.

townName.description: For Ecommerce Goods payments, alongside the paymentContext code field, this is also mandatory.

deliveryAddress.description: For Ecommerce Goods payments, alonside the paymentContext code field, this is also mandatory.

merchantCategoryCode.description: For Ecommerce payments, alongside the paymentContext code field, this is also required. Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.

merchantCustomerIdentification.description: For Ecommerce payments, alongside the paymentContext code field, this is also mandatory. The unique customer identifier of the PSU with the merchant.

paymentContextCode.description: A new field for payment context code is required as this is now mandated by a number of Banks to support payment monitoring. Valid for all payment types.

peer2PeerIdentification.description: contains the sort-code and the account number of the customer to suffice peer to peer transfers

peer2PeerBankName.description: contains the bank name of the customer to suffice peer to peer transfers. Brackets (eg. "()", "[]", "{}") are not allowed in this field.

peer2Peerinfo.description: This block of information is required to be send by the merchant to Payit application for PEER to PEER payment. This contains the destination account information.

preferredAcctIdentification.description: contains the sort-code only or the sort-code and the account number of the preferred account number for the customer

preferredAcctBankName.description: Contains the preferred account bank name.

paymentServiceUser.description: Contains an identifier for the customer. This field will be used for "remember me functionality". This might contain the customer email address

preferredAcctInfo.description: This block of information is required to be send by the merchant to Payit application for PEER to PEER payment. This contains the source account information.

x-transaction-ID.description: Payit Application will response with back with the Transaction id.

ResponseURL.description: ResponseUrl to redirect the end customer from your site to the Payit bank selection page

TPPReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the TPP for the payment

CreationDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2020-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

Code.description: High level textual error code, to help categorise the errors.

Id.description: A unique reference for the error instance, for audit purposes, in case of unknown/unclassified errors. An RFC4122 UID used as a Error id

Message.description: Brief Error message, e.g., 'There is something wrong with the request parameters provided'

schema.description: An array of detail error codes, and messages, and URLs to documentation to help remediation.

post.description: Initiates a new scheduled payment flow

parameters.name: x-transaction-ID
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Related to EndToEndIdentification field in open banking journey

parameters.name: x-FOV-indicator
parameters.description: For production environments do not send this field or send it as false. Fov indicator will be used by to test new features in production , yet these features are not open to public - First occurrence Validation.

parameters.name: x-customer-device
parameters.description: Indicates the customers device or browser version

parameters.name: x-customer-app
parameters.description: Indicates the customers browser name or app version

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Indicates the Payit version used. For Payit version 3 use 'application/app.v3+json' value

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

companyId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Parent Company id

brandId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Brand id

currency.description: The currency in which the payment should be done, according to ISO 4217

additionalMessaging.description: Reserved - use as advised by Payit

country.description: The target country, used to filter ASPSPs, according to ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

description.description: Description for the payment, to be displayed to the user

redirectUrl.description: "The URL of the payment initiating party. This will be used to transfer the payment confirmation back to initiating party from Payit"

countryCode.description: For Ecommerce Goods payments, alongside the paymentContext code field, this is also mandatory.

townName.description: For Ecommerce Goods payments, alongside the paymentContext code field, this is also mandatory.

deliveryAddress.description: For Ecommerce Goods payments, alonside the paymentContext code field, this is also mandatory.

merchantCategoryCode.description: For Ecommerce payments, alongside the paymentContext code field, this is also required. Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.

merchantCustomerIdentification.description: For Ecommerce payments, alongside the paymentContext code field, this is also mandatory. The unique customer identifier of the PSU with the merchant.

paymentContextCode.description: A new field for payment context code is required as this is now mandated by a number of Banks to support payment monitoring. Valid for all payment types.

peer2PeerIdentification.description: contains the sort-code and the account number of the customer to suffice peer to peer transfers

peer2PeerBankName.description: contains the bank name of the customer to suffice peer to peer transfers. Brackets (eg. "()", "[]", "{}") are not allowed in this field.

peer2Peerinfo.description: This block of information is required to be send by the merchant to Payit application for PEER to PEER payment. This contains the destination account information.

preferredAcctIdentification.description: contains the sort-code only or the sort-code and the account number of the preferred account number for the customer

preferredAcctBankName.description: Contains the preferred account bank name.

paymentServiceUser.description: Contains an identifier for the customer. This field will be used for "remember me functionality". This might contain the customer email address

preferredAcctInfo.description: This block of information is required to be send by the merchant to Payit application for PEER to PEER payment. This contains the source account information.

RequestedExecutionDateTime.description: Date at which the end user (customer) want to initiate the payment to the payment requesting party. This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the time zone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

x-transaction-ID.description: Payit Application will response with back with the Transaction id.

ResponseURL.description: This URL will be the Payit APP URL, initiating party will use this URL to redirect the customer from merchant browser to Payit Application browser.

TPPReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the TPP for the payment

CreationDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

post.description:
This API will be hosted by merchants & Payit application will consume the API. Payit will consume this API when : -
A> Payit returns the payment confirmation status back to merchant when Customer is in browser session.
B> Payit experienced a non recoverable technical error in core PISP Journey.
C> End customer decides to close the browser session while on core PISP screens

parameters.name: x-transaction-ID
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Related to EndToEndIdentification field in open banking journey

parameters.name: payit-signature
parameters.description: signature to prevent replay attacks

paymentReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the bank for the payment

tppReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the TPP for the payment

description.description: Description for the payment, to be displayed to the user

status.description: Specifies the status of payment in code form.

eventName.description: For 'CustomerAbortedJourney' status, extra details will be provided at which step the journey is aborted at. For 'OtherError', 'TechnicalError', 'PaymentRejected' statuses empty value is sent

statusDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource status was updated All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

x-transaction-ID.description: Original transaction id generated by Merchant

x-tpp-ID.description: Original TPP id generated by Payit

merchantAcknowledgementId.description: A unique identifier generated by the Merchant on receipt  of the payment status update.

creationDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

code.description: High level textual error code, to help categorise the errors.

id.description: A unique reference for the error instance, for audit purposes, in case of unknown/unclassified errors. An RFC4122 UID used as a Error id

message.description: Brief Error message, e.g., 'There is something wrong with the request parameters provided'

schema.description: An array of detail error codes, and messages, and URLs to documentation to help remediation.

patch.description:
This Api will be hosted by merchants & Payit application will consume the API. Payit will consume this API when : -
A> Payit returns the payment confirmation status back to merchant when original payment was a non terminal status

parameters.description: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Related to EndToEndIdentification field in open banking journey

parameters.description: signature to prevent replay attacks

parameters.description: Payment reference generated by the banks

post.description: Initiates a new refund payment flow

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Indicates the Payit version used. For Payit version 3 use 'application/app.v3+json' value

companyId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Parent Company id

brandId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Brand id

totalNumberOfRefund.description: this field contains total number of refund count. Insure maximum 999 individual refund request per API call

totalRefundAmount.description: this field contains total refund amount

refundTransaction.description: contains one or more refund requests

XtransactionID.description: contains the original payment end to end id generated by merchant for the transaction.

TPPReferenceID.description: contains the original payment transaction id / ttp id generated by payit application for the transaction.

PaymentReferenceID.description: contains the orignial payment id supplied to merchant by payit application for the transaction.

refundAmount.description: contains the amount to be refunded to payment service user (PSU), Can contain full or the partial amount.  Goodwill refund will be checks for the threshold set.

refundDescription.description: Description for the refund, to be displayed to the user

refundFpReference.description: Faster Payments reference, generated by Payit. It is optional for merchants to provide this info.

tppRefundACKId.description: The unique identifier generated by the merchant for the refund response

CreationDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

Code.description: High level textual error code, to help categorise the errors.

Id.description: A unique reference for the error instance, for audit purposes, in case of unknown/unclassified errors. An RFC4122 UID used as a Error id

Message.description: Brief Error message, e.g., 'There is something wrong with the request parameters provided'

schema.description: An array of detail error codes, and messages, and URLs to documentation to help remediation.

post.description: Merchant Api where Payit provide refund status

parameters.name: payit-signature
parameters.description: signature generated by Payit application to prevent replay attacks

companyId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Parent Company id

brandId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Brand id

refundAckTransaction.description: contains one or more refund status

XtransactionID.description: contains the original payment end to end id generated by merchant for the transaction.

TPPReferenceID.description: contains the original payment transaction id / ttp id generated by payit application for the transaction.

fpReference.description: contains the payment unique fpReference generated by Payit

refundAmount.description: contains the amount to be refunded to payment service user (PSU), Can contain full or the partial amount.  Goodwill refund will be checks for the threshold set.

refundDescription.description: contains the reason of the refund sent by merchant

tppRefundACKId.description: contains the payit ack generated at merchant refund response.

refundFPReference.description: contains a unique refund id generated for refund transactions.

additionalInformation.description: additional information aiding status of the refund
additionalInformation.example: Merchant brand is not in correct status

MerchantAcknowledgementId.description: A unique identifier generated by the Merchant on receipt  of the payment status update.

post.description: to be used when the merchant wants to receive the latest version of reconciliation files

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Id of the company/merchant that saves version

parameters.name: reconciliationVersion
parameters.description: Version to be saved and used from now on, can only be one of the supported versions

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

daterun.description: date on which the file was generated.

CreationDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. 
 An example is below: 2021-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

ReconciliationVersion.description: Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone.  An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

400.description: Version not supported or merchant doesn't exist.

parameters.name: filetype
parameters.description: Type of reconciliation files available for merchant to download. The files are of below types :-  a) Failed - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is failed b) Successful - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is Successful  c) Inprogress - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is Inprogress d) InprogCompleted - The transaction originated BEFORE the reconciliation file generation window and terminal status of the transaction is Successful/Rejected f) Settled - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is Settled **** Sample file generation window - from 2018-06-05T00:00:00+00:00 till 2017-04-05T23:59:59+00:00***

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: date for which the file needs to be download for. Format is 2018-06-05

parameters.name: run
parameters.description: Applicable for the intra date multiple reconciliation file. If the merchant has one file generated per reconciliation file generation window ie - from 2018-06-05T00:00:00+00:00 till 2018-06-05T23:59:59+00:00 , Then set the field as 0001

parameters.name: companyIdentification
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned to the merchant company

parameters.name: brandIdentification
parameters.description: Unique identification assigned to the merchant brand

parameters.name: x-FOV-indicator
parameters.description: For production environments do not send this field or send it as false. Fov indicator will be used by to test new features in production , yet these features are not open to public - First occurrence Validation.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be sent to Payit project. Merchant can acquire the access token by calling /token endpoint for Payit application. Verb 'Bearer' needs to be used before the access token

200.description: Payit application will contain the Reconciliation File direct URL.

daterun.description: date on which the file was generated.

schema.description: contains the direct URL for the Reconciliation file location

x-FOV-Param.description:
For production environments do not send this field or send it as false. Fov indicator will be used by to test new features in production ,
      yet these features are not open to public - First occurrence

X-Fov-Indicator.name: X-Fov-Indicator
X-Fov-Indicator.description: For production environments do not send this field or send it as false. This indicator will be populated by merchant to test new features in live environment. The new live features are not open to public and will be in live proving stage

filetype.name: filetype
filetype.description: Type of reconciliation files available for merchant to download. The files are of below types :-  a) Failed - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is failed b) Successful - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is Successful  c) Inprogress - The transaction originated within the reconciliation file generation window and the terminal status of the transaction is Inprogress d) InprogCompleted - The transaction originated BEFORE the reconciliation file generation window and terminal status of the transaction is Successful/Rejected **** Sample file generation window - from 2018-06-05T00:00:00+00:00 till 2017-04-05T23:59:59+00:00***

currency.description: The currency in which the payment should be done, according to ISO 4217

country.description: The target country, used to filter ASPSPs, according to ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

reason.description: Description for the payment, to be displayed to the user

redirectUrl.description: "The URL of the payment initiating party. This will be used to transfer the payment confirmation back to initiating party from Payit"

peer2PeerIdentification.description: contains the sort-code and the account number of the customer to suffice peer to peer transfers

peer2PeerBankName.description: contains the sort-code and the account number of the customer to suffice peer to peer transfers.  Brackets (eg. "()", "[]", "{}") are not allowed in this field.

peer2Peerinfo.description: This block of information is required to be send by the merchant to Payit application for PEER to PEER payment. This contains the destination account information.

preferredAcctIdentification.description: contains the sort-code only or the sort-code and the account number of the preferred account number for the customer

preferredAcctBankName.description: Contains the preferred account bank name.

paymentServiceUser.description: Contains an identifier for the customer. This field will be used for "remember me functionality". This might contain the customer email address

preferredAcctInfo.description: This block of information is required to be send by the merchant to Payit application for PEER to PEER payment. This contains the source account information.

companyId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Parent Company id

brandId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Brand id

currency.description: The currency in which the payment should be done, according to ISO 4217

country.description: The target country, used to filter ASPSPs, according to ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

reason.description: Description for the payment, to be displayed to the user

redirectUrl.description: "The URL of the payment initiating party. This will be used to transfer the payment confirmation back to initiating party from Payit"

peer2PeerIdentification.description: contains the sort-code and the account number of the customer to suffice peer to peer transfers

peer2PeerBankName.description: contains the sort-code and the account number of the customer to suffice peer to peer transfers. Brackets (eg. "()", "[]", "{}") are not allowed in this field.

peer2Peerinfo.description: This block of information is required to be send by the merchant to Payit application for PEER to PEER payment. This contains the destination account information.

preferredAcctIdentification.description: contains the sort-code only or the sort-code and the account number of the preferred account number for the customer

preferredAcctBankName.description: Contains the preferred account bank name.

paymentServiceUser.description: Contains an identifier for the customer. This field will be used for "remember me functionality". This might contain the customer email address

preferredAcctInfo.description: This block of information is required to be send by the merchant to Payit application for PEER to PEER payment. This contains the source account information.

RequestedExecutionDateTime.description: Date at which the end user (customer) want to initiate the payment to the payment requesting party. This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the time zone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

PaymentReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the bank for the payment

TPPReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the TPP for the payment

MerchantAcknowledgementId.description: The acknowledgement identifier that was sent by the merchant merchant in payment confirmation response

Status.description: Specifies the status of payment in code form.

StatusUpdateDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource status was updated. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

Status.description: Specifies the status of payment in code form.

PaymentReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the bank for the payment

TPPReferenceID.description: The unique identifier generated by the TPP for the payment

Status.description: Specifies the status of payment in code form.

StatusDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource status was updated All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format.  All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below: 2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

companyId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Parent Company id

brandId.description: The unique identifier used when onboarding - Brand id

totalNumberOfRefund.description: this field contains total number of refund count. Insure maximum 999 individual refund request per API call

totalRefundAmount.description: this field contains total refund amount

refundTransaction.description: contains one or more refund requests

XtransactionID.description: contains the original payment end to end id generated by merchant for the transaction.

TPPReferenceID.description: contains the original payment transaction id / ttp id generated by payit application for the transaction.

PaymentReferenceID.description: contains the orignial payment id supplied to merchant by payit application for the transaction.

refundAmount.description: contains the amount to be refunded to payment service user (PSU), Can contain full or the partial amount.  Goodwill refund will be checks for the threshold set.

refundDescription.description: Description for the refund, to be displayed to the user
